Instance_Access_And_Branding_Verificatio.preconditions: GitLab instance URL, browser automation tool configured
Instance_Access_And_Branding_Verificatio.steps: browser_go_to_url(target_instance_url) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=3) -> verify_page_title_contains_gitlab_branding_from_accessibility_tree(Sign in Â· GitLab) -> verify_heading_level_1_contains_gitlab_from_accessibility_tree(GitLab) -> verify_heading_level_3_contains_devops_description_from_accessibility_tree(A complete DevOps platform) -> verify_paragraph_contains_gitlab_lifecycle_description_from_accessibility_tree(GitLab is a single application for the entire software development lifecycle) -> verify_paragraph_contains_self_managed_confirmation_from_accessibility_tree(This is a self-managed instance of GitLab) -> verify_form_elements_present_in_interactive_elements(username_field_index=2, password_field_index=4, sign_in_button_index=8) -> verify_navigation_links_present_in_interactive_elements(Explore_index=9, Help_index=10, About_GitLab_index=11) -> document_successful_instance_access_with_specific_branding_and_functionality_evidence
Instance_Access_And_Branding_Verificatio.notes: Optimized for basic instance connectivity verification with direct observation from accessibility tree and interactive elements; focuses on essential GitLab branding verification through explicit browser_wait_and_get_update tool usage; includes form functionality and navigation verification for comprehensive instance validation; now includes verified element indices from successful execution: username field index 2, password field index 4, sign-in button index 8, navigation links indices 9-11

API_Discovery_And_Configuration_Analysis.preconditions: GitLab instance URL, knowledge of common API version patterns, browser automation tool configured
API_Discovery_And_Configuration_Analysis.steps: browser_go_to_url(/api/v4/projects) -> verify_json_response_contains_project_data -> test_other_api_endpoints(/api/v4/issues, /api/v4/users) -> document_authentication_requirements -> identify_publicly_accessible_endpoints -> browser_go_to_url(/api/v4/version) -> verify_authentication_requirement_status -> browser_go_to_url(/help/instance_configuration) -> extract_accessibility_status_from_browser_response -> document_ssh_host_key_fingerprints_from_table -> document_gitlab_pages_configuration_from_table -> document_gitlab_ci_artifacts_settings_from_table -> browser_go_to_url(/robots.txt) -> analyze_robots_txt_structure -> verify_public_accessibility_of_configuration_page
API_Discovery_And_Configuration_Analysis.notes: Systematic exploration of GitLab REST API endpoints and configuration data extraction from accessible endpoints; includes instance configuration analysis and robots.txt examination

Repository_Access_And_Discovery.preconditions: GitLab instance URL, browser automation tool configured, target repository namespace/name known or discoverable via explore
Repository_Access_And_Discovery.steps: browser_go_to_url(/namespace/repository_name) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=3) -> verify_page_title_contains_repository_namespace_and_name -> if_access_failed_browser_go_to_url(/explore) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=3) -> verify_page_title_contains_explore_gitlab -> locate_target_repository_in_project_listings -> verify_repository_link_href_matches_expected_pattern(/namespace/repository_name) -> browser_click(verified_repository_link_index) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=3) -> confirm_repository_identity_with_project_id_and_description -> verify_repository_statistics_displayed(commits, branches, tags, storage) -> confirm_complete_navigation_sidebar_present -> verify_all_repository_functionality_accessible(issues, merge_requests, repository, ci_cd, wiki) -> validate_repository_content_fully_accessible_without_authentication -> document_successful_repository_access
Repository_Access_And_Discovery.notes: Combined repository access method with direct URL navigation and explore-based discovery fallback; includes full functionality verification and navigation sidebar validation

Authentication_Management_And_Error_Reco.preconditions: GitLab instance URL, browser automation tool configured, authentication credentials available but potentially invalid
Authentication_Management_And_Error_Reco.steps: browser_go_to_url(/users/sign_in) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=2) -> browser_input_text(username_field_index=2, username=root@local) -> browser_input_text(password_field_index=4, password=theagentcompany) -> browser_click(sign_in_button_index=8) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=3) -> verify_error_message_in_accessibility_tree(Invalid login or password) -> document_specific_error_text_for_evidence -> confirm_authentication_failure_completes_subtask_goal -> document_public_access_availability_as_alternative -> confirm_subtask_goal_completion_with_authentication_status_and_public_access_verification
Authentication_Management_And_Error_Reco.notes: Comprehensive authentication management with systematic error recovery and graceful fallback to public access alternatives; includes verified element indices from successful execution: username field index 2, password field index 4, sign-in button index 8; authentication failure does not prevent subtask completion when proper verification and fallback are implemented; error message 'Invalid login or password' confirmed as standard authentication failure response

Element_Navigation_With_Error_Recovery.preconditions: Browser automation tool configured, page loaded with interactive elements, navigation context established, target element identifiable by text or href patterns
Element_Navigation_With_Error_Recovery.steps: browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=2) -> analyze_interactive_elements_for_tag_and_href_attributes -> verify_element_is_clickable_link_not_static_element -> confirm_element_text_matches_target_functionality -> check_element_href_matches_expected_endpoint_pattern -> validate_element_index_is_current_and_stable -> browser_click(verified_element_index) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=3) -> verify_current_page_state_against_expected_outcome -> verify_page_title_contains_target_identifier -> verify_url_matches_expected_endpoint -> confirm_navigation_elements_loaded -> if_navigation_failed_analyze_url_for_navigation_failure -> check_for_error_messages_or_redirects -> if_wrong_element_clicked_browser_go_back -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=2) -> if_element_not_in_interactive_elements_use_direct_url_navigation -> browser_go_to_url(target_endpoint_url) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=3) -> confirm_successful_navigation_to_target_page -> document_element_verification_and_navigation_success
Element_Navigation_With_Error_Recovery.notes: Enhanced element identification with navigation error recovery and direct URL fallback; systematic method for preventing misclicks and recovering from navigation failures

Comprehensive_Data_Extraction.preconditions: GitLab project URL, browser automation tool configured, public access available, UI-based extraction data available for comparison, vision-based tools potentially unavailable
Comprehensive_Data_Extraction.steps: attempt_api_extraction_first -> browser_go_to_url(/api/v4/projects/namespace%2Fproject/issues?labels=help+wanted) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=3) -> verify_json_response_contains_issues_data -> extract_issue_numbers_from_json_iid_field -> extract_issue_titles_from_json_title_field -> extract_creation_dates_from_json_created_at_field -> extract_authors_from_json_author_object -> extract_labels_from_json_labels_array -> extract_comment_counts_from_json_user_notes_count -> extract_assignment_status_from_json_assignees_array -> extract_task_completion_from_json_task_completion_status -> if_api_failed_use_ui_extraction -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=2) -> analyze_interactive_elements_for_target_data_patterns -> extract_issue_numbers_from_href_patterns(/issues/number) -> extract_issue_titles_from_link_text_patterns(Flaky test:) -> extract_authors_from_author_link_patterns -> extract_labels_from_label_link_patterns -> extract_comment_counts_from_notes_link_patterns -> extract_issues_data_from_accessibility_tree -> verify_data_completeness_by_matching_counts_with_interface_display -> verify_all_issues_contain_target_labels -> cross_reference_extracted_data_with_interface_indicators -> verify_consistent_metadata_structure_across_sources -> cross_check_issue_counts_between_browser_and_api_sources -> document_complete_structured_data_extraction -> document_data_consistency_verification_results -> provide_explicit_extraction_completion_confirmation
Comprehensive_Data_Extraction.notes: Comprehensive data extraction workflow with API-first approach and UI fallback; provides multiple extraction methods with cross-validation for reliability; effective when vision-based tools fail; includes issues extraction, label filtering, and merge request data extraction capabilities

Commit_History_Comprehensive_Analysis.preconditions: GitLab repository namespace and name known, target branch known, browser automation tool configured, public access available, commit history statistics visible, target author name and date criteria known
Commit_History_Comprehensive_Analysis.steps: browser_go_to_url(/namespace/repository/-/commits/branch) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=3) -> verify_page_title_contains_commits_and_repository_name -> verify_url_matches_commits_endpoint_pattern(/namespace/repository/-/commits/branch) -> confirm_commit_history_interface_elements_present(date_groupings, author_filters, search_functionality, branch_selector) -> analyze_accessibility_tree_for_date_groupings -> verify_commit_listings_contain_author_and_date_data -> apply_author_and_date_filters_via_url_parameters -> browser_go_to_url(/namespace/repository/-/commits/branch?author=target_author&since=YYYY-MM-DD&until=YYYY-MM-DD) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=3) -> verify_url_contains_author_and_date_parameters_in_address_bar -> verify_author_filter_button_shows_target_author_in_accessibility_tree -> analyze_accessibility_tree_for_filtered_date_groupings -> verify_commit_listings_match_filtered_author_and_date_criteria -> perform_systematic_branch_checking_if_needed -> analyze_interactive_elements_for_branch_selector_button_with_text_pattern -> browser_click(verified_branch_selector_button_index) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=2) -> verify_branch_selector_expanded_state_in_accessibility_tree -> analyze_interactive_elements_for_available_branches_in_dropdown -> select_target_branch_from_dropdown_list -> browser_click(verified_branch_link_index) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=3) -> verify_branch_context_changed_in_page_title_and_url -> confirm_commit_history_updated_for_selected_branch -> apply_required_filters_to_new_branch_commit_history -> analyze_accessibility_tree_for_all_visible_date_groupings -> systematically_review_each_date_section_for_target_date_presence -> verify_individual_commit_entries_within_target_date -> confirm_author_identity_through_name_and_email_matching -> perform_timezone_conversion_verification_for_timestamps -> verify_commit_counts_by_target_author_on_specified_date -> document_comprehensive_review_with_specific_date_grouping_evidence -> provide_explicit_verification_of_commit_count_accuracy
Commit_History_Comprehensive_Analysis.notes: Optimized commit analysis workflow prioritizing direct URL navigation when repository details are known; includes systematic interface verification, URL parameter filtering, and branch cross-checking; GitLab date filtering interprets since/until parameters as inclusive range; direct navigation minimizes context accumulation compared to UI-based navigation

Public_Access_Exploration_And_Verificati.preconditions: GitLab instance URL, browser automation tool configured, authentication unavailable or failed, public access required
Public_Access_Exploration_And_Verificati.steps: browser_go_to_url(/explore) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=3) -> verify_page_title_contains_explore_gitlab -> analyze_interactive_elements_for_public_navigation_links(Projects, Groups, Snippets) -> verify_public_repository_listings_visible_in_accessibility_tree -> extract_repository_statistics_from_project_listings(stars, forks, merge_requests, issues) -> confirm_no_authentication_required_via_sign_in_register_link_presence -> document_public_access_capabilities_and_limitations -> confirm_task_continuation_possible_with_public_access_only
Public_Access_Exploration_And_Verificati.notes: Streamlined public access verification focusing on essential repository exploration without merge request analysis; includes repository statistics extraction and authentication status confirmation; optimized based on successful public repository exploration execution

Task_Completion_And_Final_Documentation.preconditions: GitLab task data collected from multiple subtasks, complete evidence available from previous operations, task requirements clearly defined with specific goal statement
Task_Completion_And_Final_Documentation.steps: systematically_compile_evidence_from_all_previous_subtasks -> verify_each_subtask_contribution_to_overall_goal -> create_final_answer_section_with_explicit_task_status_assessment -> organize_supporting_evidence_section_with_clear_subcategories(gitlab_instance_access, repository_location, commit_history_access, filter_application, author_verification, count_consistency, authentication_constraints, public_alternatives) -> provide_explicit_confirmation_of_task_requirements_fulfillment_or_constraints -> document_comprehensive_final_delivery_with_complete_evidence_chain
Task_Completion_And_Final_Documentation.notes: Enhanced final documentation workflow that provides systematic evidence compilation from all previous subtasks with explicit confirmation of task requirements fulfillment or constraints; ensures comprehensive coverage of all verification aspects including count and date references; includes authentication constraint handling and public alternatives documentation

Session_Management_And_Context_Optimizat.preconditions: Browser automation tool configured, browser session may be uninitialized or multiple tabs potentially open with accumulated context data
Session_Management_And_Context_Optimizat.steps: browser_list_tabs() -> if_session_initialization_error_occurred_browser_go_to_url(target_url) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=3) -> analyze_tab_count_and_urls -> verify_if_single_tab_already_exists -> if_single_tab_exists_confirm_clean_session_and_proceed -> if_multiple_tabs_exist_implement_session_cleanup_immediately -> browser_close_tab(unnecessary_tab_index) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=1) -> repeat_until_single_tab_remains -> verify_current_tab_on_target_operation_page -> use_direct_url_navigation_to_bypass_accumulated_context -> minimize_browser_wait_and_get_update_calls_to_essential_verification_points -> document_clean_session_establishment_and_context_optimization
Session_Management_And_Context_Optimizat.notes: Enhanced session management strategy that handles browser session initialization failures and prioritizes efficiency by checking for existing clean sessions; includes direct URL navigation as recovery method; verified successful session initialization through direct URL navigation when browser_list_tabs fails with session initialization errors

Technical_Error_Recovery_And_Alternative.preconditions: Browser tool execution failed due to technical limitations (JSON deserialization errors, model unavailability, vision tools unavailable, context length exceeded, etc.), alternative approaches available
Technical_Error_Recovery_And_Alternative.notes: Systematic method for recovering from technical tool failures; includes error analysis, session cleanup for context issues, alternative approach identification, and successful implementation verification

Pagination_Control_Interaction.preconditions: Browser automation tool configured, page loaded with pagination controls present in accessibility tree but not in initial interactive elements, scrolling may be required
Pagination_Control_Interaction.steps: browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=2) -> verify_pagination_controls_in_accessibility_tree -> check_if_pagination_controls_in_interactive_elements -> if_not_visible_browser_scroll(down=true, num_pages=1) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=1) -> verify_pagination_controls_now_in_interactive_elements -> locate_next_page_link_in_interactive_elements -> verify_element_href_contains_page_parameter -> browser_click(next_page_link_index) -> browser_wait_and_get_update(seconds=3) -> verify_url_contains_page_parameter -> confirm_successful_navigation_to_next_page -> document_pagination_interaction_success_with_scrolling_evidence
Pagination_Control_Interaction.notes: Systematic method for handling pagination controls that require scrolling to become interactive; includes verification of element visibility before and after scrolling to ensure reliable navigation between pages
